item.description:
Dawn of a New Age!

Thursday, July 21
8:30 - 10:00 p.m.
Goodbye, Space Shuttle! Join us as we celebrate the shuttle's contributions to our national space program, and journey to the asteroid belt to learn about the new Dawn Spacecraft, which orbits the asteroid Vesta this month. Discover ion propulsion, the new way of powering the engines that explore our solar system! See the Summer Triangle overhead, check out the magnificent Wild Duck Cluster and view the beautiful gold and blue double star Albireo.

There wil a $10 charge for adults for this venue which includes a full presentation inside in the Digital Alden Planetarium plus an outdoor Sky Watch through Telescopes provided by the Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc.

There is a $8 discount for members of the Ecotarium or the Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc.

If you have a telescope and would like to help out with the outdoor observing, please contact me. This a fun event and a great way to get back into astronomy with everything aimed at beginners. Beverages and munchies served for adults and great munchies for children too! 

Children - $6 charge

 

---Jim J. Zebrowski

Organizer Oxford Astronomy Meetup Group 

President Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc.

Starfest 2011 flyers are available - this will be on saturday, August 6th 2011 on the campus of Anna Maria College in Paxton, MA. from 6PM to 10 PM with loads of indoor and outdoor activities, talks, door prizes, raffles and outdoor observing! Check the Aldrich website for a flyer describing the event! www.aldrichastro.org Ask questions or sign up for this event - aldrichastro@live.com
item.name: Ecotarium Sky Watch for July 21, 2011 Dawn of a New Age!
